title: Truth and Perception
description: Two perspectives on objective vs. subjective truth

conversation.speaker: A
conversation.content: Truth is objective and exists independently of our perceptions. Mathematical proofs demonstrate this - 2+2=4 regardless of belief.

conversation.speaker: B
conversation.content: But our perception shapes what we recognize as truth. Different cultures have different 'truths' about morality and meaning.

conversation.speaker: A
conversation.content: Cultural truths are values, not truths. Values vary, but facts remain constant across contexts.

conversation.speaker: B
conversation.content: Yet quantum physics shows observation affects reality itself. The observer and observed are inseparable.

patterns.description: Thesis-antithesis structure with competing epistemological frameworks
